'''Paola Sebastiani''' is a [[biostatistics|biostatistician]] and a [[Professor]] at [[Boston University]] working in the field of [[genetic epidemiology]], building prognostic models that can be used for the dissection of complex traits. Her most important contribution is a model based on a [[Bayesian network]] that integrates more than 60 [[single-nucleotide polymorphism]]s (SNPs) and other [[biomarker]]s to compute the risk for stroke in patients with [[sickle cell anemia]]. This model was shown to have high sensitivity and specificity and demonstrated, for the first time, how an accurate risk prediction model of a complex genetic trait that is modulated by several interacting genes can be built using Bayesian networks.<ref name="pmid15778708">{{cite journal | author = Sebastiani P, Ramoni MF, Nolan V, Baldwin CT, Steinberg MH | title = Genetic dissection and prognostic modeling of overt stroke in sickle cell anemia | journal = [[Nature Genetics]] | volume = 37 | issue = 4 | pages = 435–40 |date=April 2005 | pmid = 15778708 | pmc = 2896308 | doi = 10.1038/ng1533 | accessdate = 2009-02-03}}</ref>

Sebastiani obtained a first degree in [[Mathematics]] from the [[University of Perugia]], Italy (1987), an [[M.Sc.]] in [[Statistics]] from [[University College London]] (1990), and a [[Ph.D.]] in Statistics from the [[Sapienza University of Rome]] (1992). Her research interests include [[Bayesian probability|Bayesian modeling]] of biomedical data, particularly [[genetics|genetic]] and [[genomic]] data. She came to Boston University in 2003, after previously having been an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics at the [[University of Massachusetts Amherst]].<ref name="urlPaola Sebastiani">{{cite web | url = http://sph.bu.edu/index.php?option=com_sphdir&id=239&Itemid=340&INDEX=11326 | title = BU Homepage for Paola Sebastiani | format = | work = | accessdate = 2009-02-03}}</ref>

A controversial paper regarding the genetics of aging with which she was associated was retracted from the journal ''[[Science (journal)|Science]]'' in 2011 due to flawed data.<ref name='nyt'>{{cite web|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/07/23/science/23retract.html?_r=0|title=Scientists Retract Report on Predicting Longevity|date=22 July 2011}}</ref><ref name="science">{{cite news|url=http://news.sciencemag.org/scienceinsider/2011/07/sciencelongevity-paper-retracted.html|title=Science Longevity Paper Rectracted|date=July 2011}}</ref> The corrected version was published in [[PLOS ONE]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0029848#pone-0029848-g010|title=PLOS ONE: Genetic Signatures of Exceptional Longevity in Humans|publisher=Plosone.org|accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref> and several of the genes found associated with exceptional human longevity were replicated in other studies of centenarians.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1474-9726.2012.00808.x/full|title=Human longevity and common variations in the LMNA gene: a meta-analysis|publisher=Onlinelibrary.wiley.com|accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.plosone.org/article/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0099580#pone-0099580-g001|title=PLOS ONE: Genetic Variants in PVRL2-TOMM40-APOE Region Are Associated with Human Longevity in a Han Chinese Population|publisher=Plosone.org|accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11357-013-9593-0#page-1|title=The rs1333049 polymorphism on locus 9p21.3 and extreme longevity in Spanish and Japanese cohorts|author=Tomàs Pinós|publisher=Link.springer.com|accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3808698/|title=Meta-analysis of genetic variants associated with human exceptional longevity|publisher=Ncbi.nlm.nih.gov|accessdate=15 October 2014}}</ref>

==Publications==
She has published several peer-reviewed papers. According to [[Scopus]] the most cited ones are:

*Ramoni, M.F., Sebastiani, P., Kohane, I.S., "Cluster analysis of gene expression dynamics" (2002) ''[[Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America]]'', 99 (14), pp. 9121–9126.

*Sebastiani, P., Ramoni, M.F., Nolan, V., Baldwin, C.T., Steinberg, M.H., "Genetic dissection and prognostic modeling of overt stroke in sickle cell anemia" (2005) ''[[Nature Genetics]]'', 37 (4), pp. 435–440.

*Mandl, K.D., Overhage, J.M., Wagner, M.M., Lober, W.B., Sebastiani, P., Mostashari, F., Pavlin, J.A., Gesteland, P.H., Treadwell, T., Koski, E., Hutwagner, L., Buckeridge, D.L., Aller, R.D., Grannis, S., "Implementing syndromic surveillance: A practical guide informed by the early experience" (2004) ''Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association,'' 11 (2), pp. 141–150.

*Sebastiani, P., Gussoni, E., Kohane, I.S., Ramoni, M.F., Baker, H.V., "Statistical challenges in functional genomics" (2003) ''[[Statistical Science]],'' 18 (1), pp. 33–70.
